div.l: That schee hadde lerned in thee Nvnnerye
¶ A dowghtter hadde they by twixen hem two
Of twenty yeer wᵗith owten anye moo
Savingge a chyild that was offe half yeer age
In cradell it lay and was a propre page
This wenche thicke and well growen schee was
Wᵗith camvsed nose and Eeyen as graye as glas
Wᵗith buttokes brode ⁊and brestis rownde ⁊and heye
But ryght fayir was here heer I will not lye
¶ Thee ꝑpersovn of thee town for schee was so feyir
In purpos was to make here his Eeyir
Bothe offe his catell and of his Messewage
And strawnge hee made it of here Mariage
His pᵘurpos was to bee stowe here heye
Into svm worthy blood of awncetrye
For holy cherche good moot been despended
On holy cherchis blood that is dessended
Theer fore hee wolde his holy blood honovre
Thowgh that hee holy cherche scholde devoure
Greet sokene hath this Mellere owt of dowte
Wᵗith whete and Malt offe all thee land a bowte
¶ And namelye theer was a greet colegge
Men klepyht thee soler halle at Cambregge
Theer was here whete ⁊and here Malt I grownde
And on a day it happede in a stownde
Syk lay thee Mavnciple on a Maledye
Men wendyn witterlye that hee scholde deye
For wyche this Mellere stale bothe Mele ⁊and corn
An hundred tyme more thānne hee dede be forn
For there be fore hee stale but cvrteysly
But now hee was a theef owtrageouslyowtragouslyowtrageusly
For wyche thee wardeyn chidde ⁊and made fare
But theer offe sette thee Mellere nowt a tare
Hee crakede bost ⁊and swore hit was nowght soo
¶ Thanne were there yonge skoleris twoo
That dwelten īn thee halle of wyche I saye
Testyif they weren and lusty to playe
And oonlye for here merthe and reuerye
And vppon thee wardeyn bisilye they crye
To yeve hem leue but a lytell stownde
To goon to Melle and seen here corn I grownde
And hardily they durste leye here necke
Thee Mellere scholde nowt stele hēm halfe a pecke
Of corn ne bee slyghtte ne by fors hem be reve
And atte thee laste thee wardeyn yaf hem leve
¶ Iohn heyghtte that oon ⁊and aleyn heyghtte that other
Of a town were born that heyghtte strother
Fer in thee norht I can nowt telle where
This aleyn makyht redy alle his gere
And on an hors thee sak hee caste anoon
Foorht gooht aleyn thee clerk ⁊and also Iohn
Wᵗith good swerd ⁊and wᵗith bokeler by here syde
Iohn knewe thee wey well hym nedede no gyde
And atte the Melne the sak down they leyht
Aleyn spak ferst al hayl symvnd hee seyht
How faris yowre fayr dowghtter ⁊and yowre wyif
Aleyn welcome qduod symkyn bee my lyif
And Iohn also how now what do yee here
By god qduod Iohn symond nede has no pere
Hym by hovis serve hym self that has no swayn
Or ellis hee is a fool as klerkis sayin
¶ Owre Mawnciple I hope hee will bee deed
Swa werkis hym ay the vaynis in his heed
And theer fore i i is comen and also alayn
To grynde owre corn and carie it hom a gayn
I praye yow spede vs hethene that yee may
Hit schall be done qduod symkin bee my fay
What will yee doon while that it is in hande
By god ryght bee the hoꝑpere will I stande
Quod Iohn and see how gatis the corn goos in
Yit sawe I nevere bymy fader kyn
How thee hoꝑpere waggede two and froo
Aleyn asswerde and seyde wilt thow soo
¶ Thanne wille I been by nethe by my crown
And see how that thee Mele falles a down
Into thee trowgh that schall bee my desport
For Iohn in fayht I may bee of yowre sort
I am as evell a Mellere as are ye
